* True love - love without motive, condition or attachment
  −   −
There are also [[Greek words for love|six Greek terms]] for differing types of love:
  −
*''[[Eros (love)|Eros]]'' - erotic love; sometimes portrayed as romantic love. More characterized by passion for a singular person and sexual desire.
  −
*''[[Platonic love|Platonic]]'' - love between friends, or love where sexual desires are not present (sometimes referred to as ''philos'' instead)
  −
*''[[Storge]]'' - a friendly, affectionate type of love. Sometimes has been portrayed as parental or familial love.
  −
*''[[Philia|Philos]]'' - a pluralistic type of "love", also sometimes written as a friendship type of love
  −
*''[[Agape]]'' - a selfless, giving love, the love one has for all of humanity or for others simply because of their human nature
  −
*''[[Mania (mythology)|Mania]]'' - obsessive love (a minor type of love)
  −
'''
